summary: The Retirement Security for American Hostages Act of 2025 amends the Social Security Act to provide retirement security to U.S. nationals who were unlawfully or wrongfully detained or held hostage abroad. It deems these individuals to have earned a monthly wage equivalent to 1/12th of the national average wage index during their qualifying detention periods. The Social Security Commissioner is tasked with creating regulations to implement the act, with applications and certifications required. The amendments take effect 24 months after enactment.
